video.title: Flexbox Layouts: CSS Tutorial (Day 22 of CSS3 in 30 Days)
video.description:
Create modern layouts with Flexbox!

⭐️Files you need ⭐️
💻Flexbox Code: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/cy38pnmczmwv7fx/AABKEMK0ifvsvNc4wMzFeCIta?dl=0

replies.author: Vishvas Choudhary
replies.text:
if you inspect the element the article already have a margin-bottom of 2% in another css file, and with the case of 
margin: 0 2% it is overwriting the previous value therefor he set the values of left and right margin separately or you can also write margin: 0 2% 2%; which will also work.

topLevelComment.author: Muhammad Adnan
topLevelComment.text: It should be grid instead of flex

replies.author: Simone Icardi
replies.text: The main difference is that Grid works on two dimensions contemporary, while Flexbox one dimension at a time. For this, I find better Grid fits macro layouts, and flex for micro, but it still depends on the specific features of the layout itself.

replies.author: Muhammad Adnan
replies.text: Grid has two columns layout where flex only one

replies.author: Dink Thifferently
replies.text: Grid as of now has less browser support than flex. It's good to know both, and you can also combine flex with grid. Grid is not necessarily a replacement for flex; they both have their purpose.
